news.title: UK may see record for this year's hottest day broken
news.summary: Temperatures could peak at 33C on Friday, breaking Thursday's record for hottest day of the year.

news.title: Government whip quits over disability benefit cuts
news.summary: The Labour MP says she could not vote for the welfare bill published by the government earlier this week.

news.title: Telegram boss says he has fathered more than 100 children
news.summary: The tech tycoon says all of his offspring will share his estimated $13.9bn fortune.

news.title: Public don't back aid spending any more, says minister
news.summary: Douglas Alexander, a former international development secretary, says the argument for aid has been "lost".

news.title: China criticises UK warship's patrol in Taiwan Strait
news.summary: China said the HMS Spey's transit "undermines peace and stability" in the region.

news.title: Screen children in schools to find lazy eyes early, experts warn
news.summary: The British and Irish Orthoptic Society is calling for screening to take place in all schools in England.

news.title: Adorable or just weird? How Labubu dolls conquered the world
news.summary: The dolls have almost tripled their maker's profits - and, according to some, energised Chinese soft power.

news.title: The Papers: 'A good death' and 'Royal AscHot'
news.summary: The looming vote on the assisted dying bill features prominently on the front pages of Friday's papers.

news.title: 'He's got such an aura' - Farrell's rise to Lions top job
news.summary: As he prepares to take charge for the first time, BBC Sport looks at Andy Farrell's journey to becoming British and Irish Lions head coach.
